nodes.name: Read CSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Infer the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.title: Column Names for the CSV

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: text
fields.value:
Key Insights:


  • Chart 1
  • Segment 2 represents the largest segment, contributing around 56.2% of the total customer spend. Focusing on this segment can drive significant revenue growth.


  • Chart 2
  • Among all customer segments, Segment 2 stands out with the highest customer count which means that customers in this segment are more responsive to the coupon, indicating a substantial customer base in this group.


  • Chart 3
  • Our largest customer segment, Segment 2, stands out not only for its size but also for its high spending behavior. This segment is primarily composed of customers aged 45-54, signifying a significant share of our valuable and financially active customer base. Following closely is the 35-44 age segment, which also contributes significantly to our customer base and spending.


  • Chart 4
  • Segment 2 emerges as the dominant force in both customer count and spending, making it a crucial driver of our business growth. Within Segment 2, the most significant contributors to high spending are customers with income ranges between 35-49k and 50-74k. These income groups play a pivotal role in fueling our revenue and represent an important target for our marketing and engagement strategies.


  • Chart 5
  • Segment 2 holds the largest customer count, where 42.5% are married, 42.05% are single, and the rest have unknown marital status.
fields.title: Text
fields.description: Displaying rich text
